info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH INTENSE LIGHTNING WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL CATAWBA...ALEXANDER AND NORTHWESTERN IREDELL COUNTIES UNTIL 745 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with intense lightning 5 miles southwest of Taylorsville, or 4 miles north of Bethlehem, moving east at 20 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Taylorsville, Bethlehem, Stony Point, Lookout Shoals Lake, Lake Hickory, St. Stephens, Hiddenite, Little River In Alexander County, Millersville and Ellendale. In addition to intense lightning, very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices. Do not take a shower or bath. Try to unplug unnecessary appliances before the storm approaches.
